channel.title: /biz/ Ticker Threads
channel.description: Ticker mention threads with inline replies

item.title: [NOT] Welcome to /biz/ - Business & Finance — 1 replies
item.content:encoded:
[NOT] Welcome to /biz/ - Business & Finance

Open thread • Replies: 1 • Updated: 2025-04-25 20:50 UTC

OP

This board is for the discussion of topics related to business, economics, financial markets, securities, currencies (including cryptocurrencies), commodities, etc -- as well as topics relating to starting and running a business.

Discussions of government policy must be strictly limited to economic policies (fiscal and monetary). Discussions of a political nature should be posted on >>>/pol/. Global Rule 3 is also obviously in effect.

Note: /biz/ is NOT a place for ADVERTISING or SOLICITING. Do NOT use it to promote your business, ventures, or anything you may have an interest in. Anything that looks remotely like advertising or soliciting will be removed. Begging/asking (including tipping) for cryptocurrencies or asking for money/capital is also strictly forbidden.

Replies (oldest → newest)

60278993
Check the catalog before posting a new thread!Reply to existing threads about a topic instead of starting a new one. Mods will delete obvious duplicate threads and spam without notice.

item.title: [BTC BUY CLI GUI TX] /XMR/ Monero General — 248 replies
item.content:encoded:
[BTC BUY CLI GUI TX] /XMR/ Monero General

Open thread • Replies: 248 • Updated: 2026-02-15 16:49 UTC

OP

Welcome to /XMR/ Monero General, dedicated to the discussion of the world's most widely adopted privacy coin.

XMR payments are anonymous, low-fee, and fully fungible. Users can send and receive XMR globally without having to worry about tainted coins. Battle-tested privacy tech (Ring Signatures, Stealth Addresses and RingCT) ensures that critical TX data cannot be gleaned from the Monero blockchain; the TX history of all XMR users is kept hidden, with TXs being optionally transparent via the aid of a view key.

XMR ensures low TX fees by employing a dynamic block size that can "stretch" to easily accommodate sudden TX spikes.

XMR's mining algorithm, RandomX, is optimized for devices using general-purpose CPUs e.g. desktops, laptops, smartphones, tablets, keeping the barrier to entry low and ASICs out of the equation.

XMR's tail emission - 0.6 XMR per block forever - incentivizes for-profit miners to keep mining, helping boost long-term network security. This constant linear inflation trends to zero and is offset by coin loss.

XMR has proven to be the only altcoin capable of overcoming BTC's network effect by driving it out of the darknet economy BTC dominated for over 10 years. XMR is also starting to overtake BTC in clearnet commerce as well.

If you still have questions, feel free to ask. A MoneroChad will be with you shortly.

XMR Redpill: https://youtube.com/watch?v=wq6w03E2DS4

BUY XMR: https://monero.eco/exchanges/
Crypto ATMs: https://coinatmradar.com/

XMR Resources: https://monero.observer/resources/

XMR Stats: https://moneroj.net

USE XMR: https://cryptwerk.com/pay-with/xmr/

OFFICIAL WEBSITE: https://getmonero.org

MINING:
https://www.getmonero.org/get-started/mining/

WALLETS:
>Desktop
Official GUI/CLI wallet
Featherwallet
Stack Wallet

>Mobile
Cake Wallet
Monero.com
Stack Wallet
Unstoppable
Monerujo (Android)
Monfluo (Android)

>Infodumps
https://rentry.org/monero-explained
https://moneroinfodump.neocities.org

Right now it seems like very old material, links and screencaps keeps getting recycled. There's so many recent world events happening that tie in to Monero's use and we're missing a translation

Monerochan (mostly AI slop) also doesn't communicate anything about Monero
There doesn't seem to be any good image macros to share from these threads

Interested in how other people view this issue and what kind of material would get the communication standard up to the same level as its founding principles and tech

lmao moneroniggers and their copium at their finest. Go glow on some other basket weaving forum. Is it any wonder XMR generals never get banned for advertisement? Its because 4chan is backdoored with JDIF, and JDIF & Monero suck each others dicks. One big blowjob circlejerk for their father satan.

>>61848827
I feel like most of the older stuff is still applicable since it's just about the basics. See picrel as an example. However I agree that the more specific guides (for example how and where to get XMR) rarely has good pictures. Do you have other bad examples so we can make a list?

>>61849231
>>cant even tell 4channers in a simple format
Five sentences isn't hard if you ask me.
>the taxman who says "gib?"
1. You already need to be deanonymized for that. The ways you can get deanonymized will stay the same. This would also be combated by using an exchange wallet. I'd probably even use an on-ramp wallet, an off-ramp wallet and a holding wallet. This way even if you were deanonymized and the IRS asks for more than what they're allowed to ask (just the income as a number, not the sources or which bank account it went to) you'd still retain your privacy.
2. This is already possible by being coerced through various means. A view key won't change that. This is proven by your next sentence. >Normies fold faster than a wet noodle.

In short: All proposed 'new' attack vectors already exist, require additional information that isn't easily obtained (they tried for years and still couldn't get it) and are easily mitigated.
Additionally, if someone for whatever reason was willing to inform the IRS of the relevant taxes by directly allowing access to view the wallet (which still is absurd and not how it works) it'd be much easier and also less risky.

If you have any other scenarios in which view keys could be exploited which are not covered already please let me know.

All the steps take a bit of time but it's not complicated. Once you know how everything works it's no more complex than an Amazon order.

I'm not familiar with crossmark wallet.
https://www.xrptoolkit.com/connect-wallet
XRP Toolkit lists the following compatible wallets on its site:
>Bitfrost Wallet
>Ledger Device
>Xaman Wallet
>D'Cent Wallet
>Keystone
>Cobo Vault

Beside those, it also gives the option to enter an address, with this note:
>View your account or prepare transactions to be signed by another account, for example an account set as regular key.
Based on the wording here, it doesn't sound like you'd be able to actually sign transactions this way.
Read only basically; unless I'm misunderstanding the wording here.

If you want to connect and interact with XRP Toolkit, then you'll need to limit yourself to the above listed choices.

This goes to show you just how dumb and disingenuous the silly shillies are. You can ask Goldberg whatever the hell you want but he is not obligated to give you a truthful answer when M&A is involved. He wouldn't tell you so this is completely useless.
This still does not solve the CUSIP Conundrum. Words only get you so far, but right here right now in 2026 there are open Bed Bath and Beyond stores and the company that operates them is not even using the Overstock/BYON/BBBY CUSIP. They issued new securities in October using BBBYQs CUSIP.
It's already proven 100% fact that a reverse merger of the BBBYQ shell has already occurred with BBBY. There is zero counterargument.
Overstock, BYON and BBBY all kept them same CUSIP. So why now does it suddenly switch? Occams Razor solves the puzzle: BBBYQ shell reverse merger has already occured and the details are not in any known docket.
BBBY mystery has been solved by yours truly.

item.title: [DCA HYSA VOO] My wife doesn’t appreciate long term investing — 32 replies
item.content:encoded:
[DCA HYSA VOO] My wife doesn’t appreciate long term investing

Open thread • Replies: 32 • Updated: 2026-02-15 17:18 UTC

OP

She doesn’t want to DCA, max out 401ks, max out Roth. She has her 20k savings before we married in a saving account getting 0.00% interest (sat there for like 5 years) I tried to explain a HYSA, money market, and VOO. What do I do?

Replies (oldest → newest)

61853700
>>61853689
Why should she waste her money investing when she could let you do it and simply take half of it whenever she wants?

61853704
>>61853689
>max out 401ks
This is stupid. Just put enough into your 401k to get the company match, then put the rest into a Roth (if you're eligible) or a brokerage account.

61853710
>>61853689
you shouldnt be discussing investment with a woman they are retarded

61853720
>>61853699
>This is a terrible time to invest though
That depends entirely on what you're investing in. The industrial sector has been mooning ever since the Liberation Day tariffs kicked in.

61853805
let it go, lover her for different aspects

61853825
>>61853689
tell her to stop being dumb, then explain again

61853848
>>61853689
direct deposit her paycheck into your account and give her an allowance like she's a mentally retarded niggerbaby incapable of managing her own money (because she is.)

61853925
She's the bread winner isn't she? Tell her about the Comex shortage. Too late to stack physical silver. But early enough to do mining stocks. Get her a solid silver bracelet then do the minning stocks.

61853939
>>61853689
That's every woman. My wife spends her entire paycheck on bills and groceries and buying clothes and shit for her and the kids. Shift all the household expenses onto your wife so you can wisely manage the family wealth.

61853944
>>61853689
Tell her to invest in gold jewelry first.

61853986
>pull up sp500 10 year
>pull up fed brrrrrr chart, m2 then m4

if you can't convince her you find a new wife. lack of learn term thinking is not acceptable in a relationship.

61853987
You act like a man and tell her what you're going to do.

61854097
>>61853689
Manage it for her. She won't miss the money.

61854115
>>61853720
What are some good industrial stocks to invest in?

61854144
>>61853689
niggers is trying to discuss investing with a woman

61854198
>>61853986
That's stupid. Just rape her and tell her what to do with her money like you're her husband instead of her cuck.

61854200
>>61853689
>my wife
>she manages her own finances
There's your problem

61854203
>>61854198
How’s the weather in Mumbai?

61854213
>>61854144
I am a woman. Most are low risk investors. OP really screwed up. Should have told her 2-5 years ago to buy 100 oz of silver and an ounce of gold. Worst case scenario it will be a slightly lower price if there is an emergency expense when the price is down.

61854221
>>61854213
post tits

61854232
>>61853720
That sounds wonderful, but I can't seem to find an industrials-only ETF or mutual fund that would let me participate. Anybody want to recommend one?

61854234
>>61853689

Get her preggers and put her to work in the kitchen

61854373
>>61854232

>SPDR Dow Jones Industrial Average ETF Trust, ticker DIA

61854387
>>61854198
>>61854203
You can’t rape your wife dude.

61854492
>>61853689
Women are fucking idiots and should be enslaved.

61855768
>>61853689

Divorce her now. The marriage won't work long term, and if you have kids you'll lose them, too. This marriage was probably the worse decision you have ever made.

61855836
>>61853689
buy a home? it's okay to have cash in the bank if you have lots of USD debt.

61855863

You deserve each other.
